member.name: T:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap
member.summary: Encapsulates a bitmap, which consists of the pixel data for a graphics image and its methods and attributes This class cannot be inherited.The.NET Micro Framework provides the

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.MaxWidth
member.summary: Specifies the maximum width of the display device, in pixels.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.MaxHeight
member.summary: Specifies the maximum height of the display device, in pixels.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.CenterX
member.summary: Represents the x-coordinate location of the center of the display device, in pixels.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.CenterY
member.summary: Represents the y-coordinate location of the center of the display device, in pixels.

members.member:
These have to be kept in sync with the CLR_GFX_Bitmap::c_DrawText_ flags.
Specifies that the current bitmap is opaque.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.OpacityTransparent
member.summary: Specifies that the current bitmap is transparent.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.SRCCOPY
member.summary: Copies the source rectangle directly to the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.PATINVERT
member.summary: Inverts the source rectangle.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DSTINVERT
member.summary: Inverts the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.BLACKNESS
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle with the color associated with index number 0 in the physical palette.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.WHITENESS
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle with the color associated with index number 1 in the physical palette.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DSTGRAY
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle with a gray color.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DSTLTGRAY
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle with a light gray color.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DSTDKGRAY
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle with a dark gray color.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.SINGLEPIXEL
member.summary: Specifies that a circle should have only a single-pixel border and no fill pattern or color.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.RANDOM
member.summary: Fills the destination rectangle or circle with a randomly generated pattern.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_None
member.summary: Specifies that there are no format rules.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_WordWrap
member.summary: Specifies whether a line of bitmap text automatically wraps words to the beginning of the next line when the line reaches its maximum width.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_TruncateAtBottom
member.summary: Specifies that if the bitmap text is larger than the space provided, the text is truncated at the bottom.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_Ellipsis
member.summary: Specifies that the bitmap text is trimmed to the nearest character, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of each trimmed line.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_IgnoreHeight
member.summary: Specifies that if the bitmap text is larger than the space provided, the text is drawn in its full size, rather than being scaled down to fit the value in the Height property.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_AlignmentLeft
member.summary: Specifies that text is left-aligned as it flows around a bitmap.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_AlignmentCenter
member.summary: Specifies that text is center-aligned as it flows around a bitmap.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_AlignmentRight
member.summary: Specifies that text is right-aligned as it flows around a bitmap.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_AlignmentMask
member.summary: Specifies that you can use a mask to get or set text alignment around a bitmap.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_TrimmingNone
member.summary: Not yet documented.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_TrimmingWordEllipsis
member.summary: Not yet documented.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_TrimmingCharacterEllipsis
member.summary: Not yet documented.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.DT_TrimmingMask
member.summary: Not yet documented.

member.summary: A bitmap in a format specific to the nano Framework common language runtine (CLR).

member.summary: A bitmap in GIF format.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.BitmapImageType.Jpeg
member.summary: A bitmap in JPEG format.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.BitmapImageType.Bmp
member.summary: A bitmap in Windows BMP format.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.UI.Bitmap.Flush
member.summary: Flushes the current bitmap to the display device. Bitmap will be written to the upper-left corner of the screen (full-screen, for full-screen bitmaps).

The height of the rectangle.
Flags that specify the format of the text.
The color to be used for the text.
The font to be used for the text.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.DisplayControl.MaximumBufferSize
member.summary: The maximum buffer size for Bitmap in bytes.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.DisplayControl.FullScreen
member.summary: Returns a bitmap the size of the current display.
member.remarks: Please make sure you check if you have enough memory with IsFullScreenBufferAvailable. If you don't have enough, the BitMap won't get initialized and will be null.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.DisplayControl.LongerSide
member.summary: The screens number of pixels for the longer side.

member.summary: The screens number of pixels for the shorter side.

member.summary: The displays number of pixel for the width based on the orientation.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.DisplayControl.ScreenHeight
member.summary: The displays number of pixel for the height based on the orientation.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.DisplayControl.BitsPerPixel
member.summary: Currently 16 bits in RBG565 format. ( There is some 1 bit code available but untested )

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.DisplayControl.Orientation
member.summary: Return the current display orientation landscape, portrait.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.UI.DisplayControl.ChangeOrientation(nanoFramework.UI.DisplayOrientation)
member.summary: Change the orientation of the display.
member.remarks: When the orientation is changed the display canvas is disposed and recreated with the new dimensions when DisplayControl.FullScreen is next called.
member.param: New Orientation
member.returns: True if the orientation was supported and changed.

member.summary: Contains the default kerning for a particular font. The kerning controls the amount of space between consecutive characters in a particular font.

member.summary: Gets the width of the specified character, in pixels.

member.summary: Gets the average width of the characters in the current font, in pixels.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.Font.MaxWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the widest character in the current font, in pixels.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.Font.Ascent
member.summary: Gets the ascent measurement for the current font, in pixels. A font's ascent is the vertical distance between the font baseline and the top of the font area. The ascent measurement for the current font, in pixels.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.Font.Descent
member.summary: Gets the descent measurement for the current font, in pixels. A font's descent is the vertical distance between the font baseline and the bottom of the font area. The descent measurement for the current font, in pixels.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.Font.InternalLeading
member.summary: Gets the internal leading measurement for the current font, in pixels. The internal leading measurement for the current font, in pixels.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.UI.Font.ExternalLeading

member.summary: Computes the size of the rectangular area on the display device needed to render the specified text string.
member.param: The text you want to render on the display device.
The width, in pixels, of the rectangular area needed to render the text.
The height, in pixels, of the rectangular area needed to render the text.
The x-coordinate of the relative starting point for the text.
The y-coordinate of the relative starting point for the text.
The maximum width of text that will fit in the defined rectangular area.
The maximum height of text that will fit in the defined rectangular area.
Flags that specify various text characteristics, such as alignment.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Presentation.Media.ColorUtility.To16Bpp(nanoFramework.Presentation.Media.Color)
member.summary: Converts color into a 16bit representation.
member.param: A color.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Presentation.Media.Color
member.summary: Note: Colors are not RGB 24-bit but are BGR 24-bit
